thread.title: Jerry West says he would love to see Michael Jordan on NBA logo
thread.title_full: Jerry West says he would love to see Michael Jordan on NBA logo | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Jerry West says he would love to see Michael Jordan on NBA logo
text:
Today, Lakers legend Jerry West is probably more well known for being the guy on the NBA logo than the guy that was Finals MVP in 1969.
In a recent interview with the Huffington Post though, West said he would love to see Michael Jordan take his place on the insignia.
“I hate to say it’s not a Laker, but Michael Jordan. He’s been the greatest player I’ve ever seen,” West told the Huffington Post . “And I’m probably a harsh judge of talent in the sense that I admire players that are really good defensive players and really good offensive players. And I felt that at his time in the game, he was the best defensive player in the game, but more importantly he was the best offensive player. And he made his teams win.”
The logo, which has featured West’s silhouette since 1969, generates the league more than $3 billion a year in licensing.
We NEED an @ESPN @30for30 on Jerry West!! The man's a legend & the @NBA logo #ZekefromCabinCreek RETWEET if you AGREE pic.twitter.com/n1IV8rnFhh
— George Capel (@georgewcapel) September 20, 2015
So what would a Jordan NBA logo look like?
Michael Jordan on the #NBA logo? A suggestion by current "logoman" Jerry West.
Our take: https://t.co/h6gfPXV2OJ pic.twitter.com/LLAwVtnGkK
— Chris Creamer (@sportslogosnet) October 21, 2015
Jerry West thinks a Michael Jordan silhouette is the ideal #NBA logo. Do you agree? https://t.co/krjomLCzWh pic.twitter.com/rUqECbM2k0
— DUNK360 (@theDUNK360) October 21, 2015
